data.title: Tarrant County
data.meta_description: Visit the DebbieAndBruce website now to view the available properties for sale in Tarrant County, TX. For more information, contact us.
data.text:
Colleyville lies in the tri-county triangle where Dallas, Denton and Tarrant counties meet. Colleyville housing includes residential, small acreage properties, luxury properties and Townhomes/Condos. What residents of Colleyville like is that the city feels like country but it has all the amenities of big city living. Colleyville is unique with all the roundabouts to get from here to there. (They do take a little getting used to when you are used to stop signs.) Colleyville has many parks, walking and bike trails for families to enjoy. Zip code area is 76034. Colleyville public schools are some of the best schools in the state of Texas. For information about the Colleyville Independent School District, click here.

Flower Mound is in Denton and Tarrant County in north central Texas, in the Dallas-Fort Worth metroplex. DFW International Airport is minutes away. Grapevine lake is in a portion of Flower Mound. Flower Mound is known for their multi-purpose trails, 680 acres of parks, horse trails, and unpaved hiking and biking trails. Flower Mound made Money’s #4 list of Best Places to Live in 2021. Zip code area is 75022, 75028, 76051, 76226, and 76262. For more information about the Lewisville Independent School District click here.

Fort Worth is the 12th largest city in the U.S., and is located in Tarrant County in north central Texas. Fort Worth started out as a cowboy town.You can still imagine the cowboy town Fort Worth started as when you visit the Fort Worth Stockyards and attend the rodeo. Watch the twice daily cattle drive, go to the honky tonk Billy Bob's, shop in the retail district, and you just may see some folks riding on their horses through the stockyards area. There are museums, restaurants, parks and my favorite zoo of all time - The Fort Worth zoo. Even though Fort Worth is a big city, it has managed to keep it's cowboy history alive and well. Y'all come on down and have a boot scootin’ good time. Downtown Fort Worth has many things to see from skyscrapers, historic buildings, shopping, dining, work, and more. Don’t miss visiting the Sundance Square area and the Fort Worth Water Gardens. There are many zip codes in the Fort Worth area. Types of properties in Fort Worth are residential, farm and ranch, townhomes/condos and apartments. Downtown Fort Worth has many choices for apartment to luxury townhome/condo living. For more information about the Fort Worth Independent School District click here.

Grapevine is in Tarrant, Dallas and Denton County Texas, a suburb of Dallas-Fort Worth metroplex. Grapevine is known as the Christmas Capital of Texas. It is a treat to drive through their Main Street, see all the lights, enjoy scheduled activities and shops. The only thing missing is snow, but it’s Texas. Grapevine has 8 wineries. Bass Pro Shops Outdoor Worldwide is a must visit. The Gaylord Hotel hosts many events and is right on the lake. Grapevine is close to the DFW International airport. Zip code area is 75019, 75261, 76051, 76092, and 76099. The communities of Colleyville, Grapevine, Keller, Southlake and Trophy Club lie in the tri-county triangle where Dallas, Denton and Tarrant counties meet. For more information about the Grapevine-Colleyville Independent School District click here.

Keller is in Tarrant County Texas, on US Highway 377, 15 miles north of Fort Worth in northeastern Tarrant County. The communities of Colleyville, Grapevine, Keller, Southlake and Trophy Club lie in the tri-county triangle where Dallas, Denton and Tarrant counties meet. Keller has over 300 acres of parks, 11 parks, and 26 miles of trails. They even have a dog park. Keller offers their residents a suburban feel with all the city amenities that we enjoy without traveling far. Zip code area is 76248 and 76262. Keller schools are rated one of the best school districts in the DFW area and Texas. For more information about the Keller Independent School District click here.

Lake Worth is in northwestern portion of Tarrant County Texas, in the Dallas-Fort Worth metropolitan area. The Fort Worth Nature Center and Refuge has 3,000 acres of trails and is located on the West Fork of the Trinity river at the headwaters of Lake Worth. Zip code area is 76114, 76135 and 76136. Lake Worth is 3,489 acres, average depth is 6 feet, and the water controlling authority is the City of Fort Worth Lake Worth Management Office. For more information about the Independent School District click here.

Southlake is in Tarrant County Texas and a small part in Denton county. The communities of Colleyville, Grapevine, Keller, Southlake and Trophy Club lie in the tri-county triangle where Dallas, Denton and Tarrant counties meet. Southlake is known as sophisticated living, affluent neighborhoods with a neighborly community. Southlake Town Square is a community favorite for shopping and dining (and one of mine too). All the parks in Southlake are just great, but in my opinion the best is Bicentennial Park. The Bob Jones Nature Center and Preserve is also in Southlake. The cuisine is diverse. DFW International airport is close by. Zip code area is 76092. Southlake schools are exemplary; Carroll ISD ranks as one of the top 5 school districts. For more information about the Carrol Independent School District click here.

Trophy Club is in Tarrant and Denton County Texas. The area was originally created as a housing development of the country club and then it grew. Trophy Club was a part of Westlake and the town incorporated in 1985 and was the first master planned community in Texas. There are 1,000 acres of parks and 36 holes of golf wind around the community. The neighborhood is affluent. The communities of Colleyville, Grapevine, Keller, Southlake and Trophy Club lie in the tri-county triangle where Dallas, Denton and Tarrant counties meet. Zip code area is 76262. For more information about the Northwest Independent School District click here.

Westlake is in Denton and Tarrant counties. Per https://namecensus.com Westlake is the third richest city in Texas so you can expect affluent neighborhood living and lovely estates. The Vaquero Golf Club is in Westlake. Some great neighborhoods to check out in Westlake are Glenwyck Farms, Granada, Terra Bella and Vaquero (see link below for active properties for sale.) DFW International airport is close by. Zip code area is 76262. For more information about the Westlake’s two school districts - Keller Independent School District click here and Birdville Independent School District click here.
